text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 2.4.8, IDRS Terminal Input - Command Codes ESIGN and BSIGN.
(1) IRM 2.4.8.1 has been revised to update Program, Scope, and Objectives.
LMSB, SB/SE, TE/GE, W&I.
Table of Contents
) Overview: This IRM Section provides an overview of the ESIGN and BSIGN Command Codes. (
) Purpose: This IRM contains procedural steps for use of the ESIGN and BSIGN Command Codes. (

) Audience: These procedures apply to IRS employees who are responsible the processing of Employer Identiﬁcation Numbers (EINs). These employees are located in the following areas: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Business/Self-Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & vestment. (
) Policy Owner: The Chief Information Officer (CIO) is responsible for oversee- ing all aspects of our systems that operate the nation’s tax infrastructure. (
) Program Owner: IT. (
) Primary Stakeholders: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Business/Self- Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment. (

) Program Goals: This IRM provides the fundamental knowledge and proce- dural guidance for employees who work with The EIN Research and Assignment System (ERAS). By following the processes and procedures provided by this IRM, employees will process new EINs in a manner that follows IRS policy and procedures while promoting he best interests of the Government. (
) This IRM and the contained sections provide the user the necessary informa- tion on how to use the command code ESIGN. (
) ESIGN was developed to allow the addition of a new account to the TIF and Master File. These transactions will be subject to IDRS Quality Review. (
) ERAS Project Lead is responsible for • Review and implementation of WRs that affect ESIGN • Updating the contents of this IRM (
) Program Reports: This process validates the command code’s input ﬁelds, checks for consistency between input ﬁeld, and builds the establishment on the TIF and to Realtime. (
) Program Effectiveness: Data is input to ERAS through a series of realtime entries: (
) BSIGN Input of this command code results in a bulk assignment of EINs. (
) ESIGN Input of this command code results in the addition of a new account the TIF and Master File. These transactions will be subject to IDRS Quality Review. Codes ESIGN and BSIGN
page
Primary Stakeholders: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Business/Self- Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment.
This IRM and the contained sections provide the user the necessary informa- tion on how to use the command code ESIGN.
ESIGN was developed to allow the addition of a new account to the TIF and Master File. These transactions will be subject to IDRS Quality Review.

ESIGND Input of this command code and deﬁner marks the TIF record, created by command code ESIGN, for deletion. This command code can be used after 2 cycles to delete ERAS established accounts that failed to post at

— BMF and EPMF: A TC
is generated to update the Master FIle with the new account. (
) TC
— BMF (non EO) Only: TC
will be generated to suppress TDI issuance if the Wages Paid Date or Business Operational Date is in a future quarter within the current year or future year. (

Command Codes ESIGN and BSIGN 2.4.8

) Notices — A notice will be generated for each entity (unless suppressed with Notice Information Code “ D” or “E” at the time of input). How a Notice Infor- mation Code is input will determine which notice the taxpayer receives (See ESIGN Input format Notice Information element description (Exhibit
) Sequence Number — The sequence number, which was inserted into the cycle ﬁeld of the IDRS record at the time ESIGN was input, is changed to an actual input cycle. (
) Quality Review — ESIGN transactions that were deleted by Quality Review have the corresponding TIF and NSF accounts deleted through daily batch processing. (

) NSF Processing — During the update attempt to the NSF by the ESIGN Command Codes an indicator will be set to determine whether the attempt successful. If this indicator shows failure to update, the ERAS daily batch pro- cessing will write the account to tape. This tape will be taken to the NAS system to be sent to MCC for update. (

) Federal National Mortgage Association (FNMA) — In BSC only, ERAS will process data from Federal National Mortgage Association on a monthly basis. This data contains an EIN and associated pool number. From this, ERAS will generate a TC
with the FRM-
-FR set. (
) ESIGNT — During the daily analysis, those entities for which ESIGNT has been used will be dropped from the TIF, and further ERAS processing. See
for a description of ESIGNT. (

) BSIGN — The range of EINs assigned with BSIGN will be validated using validation during the ERAS daily batch processing. Any EINs within the range will be identiﬁes on the Bulk Assignment Report generated for the Entity Control Unit. & (
) Accounts input from an SS–
are deleted from the TIF when the account is established on either the Business Master File or the Employee Plan Master File. (
) All other accounts established will be aged when the SS–
is received from the taxpayer or after
weeks. (
) Those entities, which were marked for deletion by ESIGND during the week, will be deleted from the appropriate TIF. (EP/EO) (

) ERAS interfaces with the EACS (EP/EO Application Control System). Exempt Organization applications are controlled on EACS when the Key District Office receives them and maintained until the determination as to whether the organi- zation qualiﬁes for exemption. (
) The application is input to EACS without an EIN. (
) The EACS Plan Case Control File (PCCF) is updated with an EACS Applica- tion Case Identiﬁer. (
) The Form SS–
is annotated with the EACS Application Case Identiﬁer and sent to the Service Center. Codes ESIGN and BSIGN

Accounts input from an SS–4 are deleted from the TIF when the account is established on either the Business Master File or the Employee Plan Master
) The Form SS–

is input with the EACS Application Case Identiﬁer via the ESIGNR command code. Note: Name and address data from the EACS PCCF (Plan Case Control File) as well as the EACS Application Case Identiﬁer will be displayed on the ESIGN screen format. A Master File Indicator of “B” or “O” must be used. (
) ERAS updates the PCCF with a valid EIN during End of Day (EOD) Process- ing. (
) Upon qualiﬁcation for exemption and receipt of a valid EIN, the Key District Office closes the “Case” and the following is produced by EACS: a. A TC
DOC-CD
(entity establishment) or TC
DOC-CD
(exempt organization status change) transaction will be generated for posting to the BMF. b. A Form
, Exemption Organization Record (EACS), will be generated daily for each “closed” EACS case. (
) For further information concerning EACS see IRM
, Chapter
, Command Code ENMOD, IRM
, Chapter

) During Real Time the following functions are performed. a. An EIN is generated from the EIN Assignment Control File (EACF), is part of the Real Time Combined Area (RTC). b. Validity checks are performed to ensure that data is as accurate as possible. c. The taxpayer’s entity information is recorded on the Name Search Facility (NSF) and either the Business Master File (BMF) or EPMF Taxpayer formation File (ZTIF). d. A record is sent through End of Day (EOD) processing to update the Master File. (

) Following are the various ERAS command code deﬁners and their descrip- tions. a. Request a formatted input screen using ESIGNR. b. Input taxpayer information from the formatted ESIGNR screen using ESIGN. c. Delete taxpayer information the same day as entry using ESIGNT. d. Delete taxpayer information that failed to post on the Master File with Unpostable Code (UPC) of
or
using ESIGND. e. Upon receipt of the SS–
, update the ERAS Notice Information Code using ESIGNU. f. Issue a block of EINs to an institution to assign to estate/trusts accounts using BSIGN. (
) This command code is used to request a formatted ESIGN input screen. (
) ESIGNR must be preceded by either Command Code NAMEE or NAMEB to

Command Codes ESIGN and BSIGN 2.4.8

Note: If an EACS Application Case Identiﬁer is entered, name and address data from the EACS PCCF (Plan Case Control File) as well as the EACS Applica- tion Case Identiﬁer will be displayed on the ESIGN screen format.

MESSAGES MEANING CODE INI- TIALIZATION INVALID ESIGNR was not preceded by either Command Code NAMEE or NAMEB. CASE NOT ON There is no case on the PCCF for the EACS Application Case Identiﬁer input. Search PCCF to verify EACS Application Case Identiﬁer. See
, Chapter

EACS APPLICA- CASE IDENTIFIER The case identiﬁer is not nine numerics followed by the literals “EO” or “ NE”. NOT AVAILABLE The PCCF was not available at the time of input — retransmit. If the ﬁle is still not available, notify your supervisor. COMPLETED No errors are present in the ESIGNR request.
The PCCF was not available at the time of input — retransmit. If the ﬁle is still not available, notify your supervisor.

The ESIGN command code is used to input taxpayer information. Taxpayer information may then be input without an EIN if one was not found, or with an EIN if one was found but is not established on the appropriate master ﬁle.
2.4.8.13(01-01-2007) Command Code ESIGN — Input Screen
Note: A Master File Indicator of “P” will not accept a reinput EIN.

) If a speciﬁc EIN is not entered on the ESIGN screen, one will be generated from the EIN Assignment Control File (EACF). The new EIN will be using the National Account Proﬁle (NAP) to ensure that the EIN does not already exist on the Master File. a. The ﬁrst two digits of an EIN no longer indicate the geographic tion (preﬁx) assigned to the account; but are associaed with particular campuses. b. The third digit of an EIN indicates whether the account is a Regular Series or an Estate/Trust Series. Note: An Estate/Trust Series EIN must consist only of the
ﬁling requirement, no other ﬁling requirements can be present. All others will be assigned Regular Series EIN. (

) Validation checks are performed to assure that the input data is as accurate and consistent as possible. If invalid conditions are present, the input be redisplayed and errors identiﬁed with an asterisk next to the item. ﬁelds are determined to be valid, an EIN will be assigned to the taxpayer’s account.

) If a speciﬁc EIN is not entered on the ESIGN screen, one will be generated from the EIN Assignment Control File (EACF). The new EIN will be validated using the National Account Proﬁle (NAP) to ensure that the EIN does not already exist on the Master File.
The NSF is a database that contains taxpayer name and address infor

mation and can be accessed using the Command Code NAMEE oe NAMEB. The BTIF and ZTIF are databases that contain the taxpayer’s account information and can be viewed using taxpayer’s EIN via the Command Code ENMOD.
2.4.8.13.1(01-01-2001) Command Code ESIGN — Valid Messages

MEANING No errors are present in the ESIGN request. - NAP The NAP is unavailable at the time of input. Command Code INOLEG should be done to validate the EIN. - If the NSF and NAP are unavailable at the time of input. Attempted to assign/reinput an EIN that has a primary/secondary sort record with this EIN already present on the NSF. If this was a reinput EIN, notify your super

visor. If this EIN was generated by ESIGN, then notify your supervisor. The EIN Preﬁx Codes identiﬁed by the EACF as valid for access by the Service Center do not agree with those EIN PREFIX codes being requested which were considered valid by ESIGN. Notify Computer Systems Analyst.
The EACF, which issues EINs and AP Sequence Numbers, was not accessible at the time of entry, retransmit. If it is still not available — notify your supervisor.
Pre-existing EINs were detected on the NAP — retransmit. If the message reoccurs have the Computer Systems Analyst determine the last EIN assigned for each preﬁx to create input ﬁle ERA
by following the Computer Operator Handbook run instructions for ERA

ERROR MESSAGES MEANING PLEASE CORRECT INVALID DATA The data ﬁeld indicated with an asterisk does not pass validity checks. REMARKS FIELD - INVALID OR INCOM- PLETE The remarks ﬁeld contains less than three non-blank characters or contains an invalid special character (=, <). REMARKS SECTION MISSING Remarks section is required for Notice Information Code “B”. TIN INVALID EIN entered does not pass standard validity checks. (current area name) - IS DOWN The database area, which is being accessed, is unavailable — retransmit. If area is still not accessible, notify your supervisor. XXXX NOT AVAILABLE The ﬁle speciﬁed (RTC, BTIF, or ZTIF) was not accessible at the time of entry — retransmit. If the ﬁle is still not available, notify your supervisor.
) This command code will be used to delete ERAS accounts that fail to post on the Master File with an Unpostable Code (UPC) of
or
) ESIGND must be preceded by Command Code ENMOD. (
) Accounts cannot be deleted unless two weeks have passed since the initial input. (

) The records will be removed from the NSF and the TIF. a. The TIF records will be marked for deletion, which is indicated by a “D” on the ENMOD screen, and removed from the database during the next weekend’s processing. b. The account will be immediately deleted from the NSF. If the account cannot be deleted immediately, it will be marked for deletion and processed during ERAS Daily Batch Processing. c. If ESIGND is input for the primary record, the secondary record will also be deleted, and vice versa. (
) The account cannot be reinput during the week that the ESIGND was done, unless the EIN has been changed. (
) See Exhibit
for ESIGND Input Format.
This command code will be used to delete ERAS accounts that fail to post on the Master File with an Unpostable Code (UPC) of 302 or 802.

The TIF records will be marked for deletion, which is indicated by a “D” on the ENMOD screen, and removed from the database during the next weekend’s processing. The account will be immediately deleted from the NSF. If the account cannot be deleted immediately, it will be marked for deletion and processed during ERAS Daily Batch Processing. If ESIGND is input for the primary record, the secondary record will also be deleted, and vice versa.
Command Codes ESIGN and BSIGN 2.4.8
Following are the valid messages for ESIGND.
This command code will be used to delete ERAS accounts on the same day they were entered.

Restrictions: Consideration must also be given to the time of the closeout of the transaction ﬁle by the computer room for each day (input between 6 p.m. and 12 p.m. for that day will be processed in the next day’s daily update.) Therefore, any ESIGN transaction input before 6 p.m., which needs to be deleted, must be deleted before 6 p.m.; any ESIGN transaction input between 6 p.m. and 12 p.m., which needs to be deleted, must be deleted before 6 p.m. the next day. Entity Control Unit managers in each service center should check with their computer room to determine their particular cut-off schedule.
(2) ESIGNT must be preceded by Command Code ENMOD.
(1) Following are the error messages for ESIGNU.

ESIGNU ERROR MESSAGES MEANING COMMAND CODE INI- TIALIZATION INVALID ESIGNU was not preceded by ENMOD. INVALID REQUEST - NOT AN ERAS RECORD There is no TIF–41 record for this account. INVALID REQUEST - ﬁle DATA NOT PRESENT There is no record on the speciﬁed ﬁle (BTIF, or ZTIF) which matches the EIN. RECORD PREVIOUSLY UPDATED ESIGNU has been attempted for a record that was previously updated by ESIGNU.

VALID MESSAGES MEANING REQUEST COMPLETED No errors are present in the BSIGN request. In addition to the input screen the beginning and ending EINs will be shown on the screen. See Exhibit 2.4.8–9.
Command Codes ESIGN and BSIGN 2.4.8
Following are the error messages for BSIGN.

ERROR MESSAGES MEANING DATA IN NON-INPUT- FIELD PLEASE CORRECT Input data did not pass the validity checks. Speciﬁc items in error are indicated with an asterisk to the right of the input ﬁeld. EACF EIN PREFIX CODE INVALID - NOTIFY CSA The EIN Preﬁx Codes identiﬁed by the EACF as valid for access by the Service Center do not agree with those EIN Preﬁx codes being requested which were considered valid by ESIGN. Notify Computer Systems Analyst. EACF NOT AVAILABLE The EACF, which issues EINs and AP Sequence Numbers, was not accessible at the time of entry, retransmit. If it is still not available, notify your supervisor. EACF SC-CODE INVALID - NOTIFY CSA The Service Center identiﬁed by the EACF as valid for access does not agree with the Service Center trying to access it. Notify Computer Systems Analyst.
The Service Center identiﬁed by the EACF as valid for access does not agree with the Service Center trying to access it. Notify Computer Systems Analyst.

Description

Required ﬁeld. The ﬁrst position must be alphabetic or numeric. Subsequent positions may be alphabetic, numeric, –, &, ], or blank. The Name Control ﬁeld must also be entered and must match the Name Control indicated on the Primary Name Line.
If the Name Control is contained in the ﬁrst four characters of the Primary Name Line, these characters will be entered in the Name Control ﬁeld.
immediately following the name that the Name Control was derived from if a suffix or partner’s name follows on the Primary Name Line.
Examples:
JONES INC (no bracket needed)
HARRY]JONES (bracket immediately preceding Jones but none needed following last name)
HARRY]JONES]& ROLAND SMITH (bracket before and after name containing name control)
The ﬁrst position is a bracket (]). Subsequent positions may be alphabetic, numeric, -, &, or blank. Any characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid.
The ﬁrst position must be alphabetic or numeric. Subsequent positions may be alpha
betic, numeric, –, &, or blank. Any characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid.
Command Codes ESIGN and BSIGN 2.4.8
Exhibit 2.4.8-2 (Cont. 3) (01-01-2014) ESIGN Input Format
Description
Description The ﬁrst position must be alphabetic or numeric. Subsequent positions may be alpha

betic, numeric, –, /, or blank. If input, Mail City State Zip or Foreign Country line must end with a period. Required ﬁeld. This is either a foreign city or the mailing street address. Valid characters are alphabetic, numeric,
, /, or blank. Required ﬁeld. This is either a foreign country, city/state/zip or a Major City Code and Zip Code. If a foreign country is entered in place of city
If a foreign country is entered in place of city name, the State Code must be entered as a period plus a blank and the Foreign Address line must be present. (See Exhibit 2.4.8–4)
City: City name must be 3 to 22 characters long. Valid characters are alphabetic or blank. The last character of the city name must be a comma, followed immediately by the State Code.

Major City Code — A two character Major City Code valid for the service center of input may be used in place of the City and State. If a Major City Code is used the Zip Code must be input. A Major City Code must be immedi- ately followed by two commas (,,).

may be used in place of the City and State. If a Major City Code is used the Zip Code must be input. A Major City Code must be immedi- ately followed by two commas (,,). State — A valid two-character State Code must follow city name and comma. For a foreign address a period plus a blank (.b) must substitute for the State Code. Does not apply if using Major City Code. Zip Code — Must begin immediately following the space after the State Code or the second comma after a Major City Code. Entry must be ﬁve or nine numeric charac- ters; valid range for the ﬁrst ﬁve characters is
to
, except the fourth and ﬁfth digits must not be

Zip Code may not be input if a foreign address. The Zip Code must be valid for the State Code entered. This is a location mailing street address. Vali- dation will be the same as street address validation in Mail Street or Foreign City/Zip line.
State — A valid two
character State Code must follow city name and comma. For a foreign address a period plus a blank (.b) must substitute for the State Code. Does not apply if using Major City Code.
This is a location mailing street address. Vali
dation will be the same as street address validation in Mail Street or Foreign City/Zip line.
Description
This is a location city/state/zip. Validation will be the same as Mail City State Zip or Foreign Country, with one exception, a comma must be present between the State ﬁeld and Zip ﬁeld.
